answer: The research opportunity mentioned is a study on the effects of Brazilian Jiu Jitsu and psychotherapy on helping people with autism develop subjective awareness of others. Participants must be between 7-21 years of age, have a diagnosis of Autism Spectrum Disorder, enroll in an approved Jiu Jitsu Academy, attend at least two sessions a week for six months, enroll in social skills groups or have psychotherapeutic relationship, and take a SRS test at the beginning, three months, and six months into the study.
